predictions.text: The U.S. Supreme Court will issue a merits decision (opinion or signed order resolving the case, not merely a scheduling order) in the case concerning President Trump’s effort to remove Fed Governor Lisa Cook, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves as TRUE if SCOTUS publishes an opinion or dispositive order on its docket that decides the merits of the Cook-removal dispute by 2026-06-30 UTC. FALSE if no merits disposition is issued by then.
evidence: NYT (2026-01-19) notes the Supreme Court is hearing arguments involving Trump’s attempt to remove Fed Governor Lisa Cook, highlighting institutional stakes.
monitoring_signals: SCOTUS docket updates: grants, argument calendar, orders list, opinions release days
Major outlets reporting on timing expectations for the decision (end-of-term rulings)
Any stay/expedited briefing order suggesting an accelerated decision timeline
predictions.rationale: High salience separation-of-powers case; merits decisions in argued cases commonly land by late June.

predictions.text: The European Commission will formally open an Anti-Coercion Instrument (ACI) case/proceeding explicitly naming the United States as the coercing third country, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: TRUE if the European Commission publishes (press release + formal notice/decision) initiating an ACI procedure/case that explicitly names the United States. FALSE otherwise by deadline.
evidence: CNBC (2026-01-19) describes Europe weighing its trade “bazooka” amid Greenland-related tariff threats.
monitoring_signals: EC Trade press releases referencing ACI, coercion, or the Anti-Coercion Instrument
EU Council/Commission statements linking Greenland tariff threats to EU countermeasures
Politico/FT reporting on internal EU deliberations about activating ACI
predictions.rationale: ACI use is politically heavy and procedurally involved; plausible if tariff threats escalate, but still a low-probability escalation within 2026.

predictions.text: The United States will announce and implement (via Federal Register notice, USTR/CBP guidance, or presidential proclamation) an additional import tariff increase of at least +10 percentage points on passenger vehicles and/or auto parts originating in the European Union, explicitly framed as retaliation connected to the Greenland dispute, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: TRUE if an official U.S. action increases tariff rates by ≥10pp on EU autos/parts and the accompanying rationale statement ties it to Greenland-related retaliation/dispute. FALSE if no such action by deadline.
evidence: CNBC (2026-01-19) highlights EU discussion of retaliation and flags autos as exposed to potential Greenland-linked tariffs.
NYT (2026-01-19) reports heightened tariff-policy volatility and readiness to respond to court setbacks.
monitoring_signals: USTR announcements and Federal Register notices on tariffs targeting EU sectors
CBP Cargo Systems Messaging Service (CSMS) guidance on new duties
White House statements explicitly linking trade measures to Greenland
predictions.rationale: Autos are politically potent and already flagged as exposed; explicit Greenland linkage is the main uncertainty.

predictions.text: The Bank of Japan will announce a reduction in its planned/targeted JGB purchase amount (or purchase operations envelope) by at least 20% versus the level stated in its January 2026 Monetary Policy Meeting materials, by 2026-07-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: TRUE if BOJ policy statement or supporting documents show JGB purchase plan reduced by ≥20% relative to the Jan 2026 stated amount. Use BOJ published purchase schedule/MPM materials for comparison. FALSE otherwise.
evidence: CNBC (2026-01-20) notes Japan’s 40-year yields at fresh highs, signaling tightening long-end conditions.
monitoring_signals: BOJ MPM statements and ‘Outlook for Economic Activity and Prices’ updates
BOJ purchase operation schedules and any explicit tapering guidance
JGB curve stress indicators (super-long yields, auction tail metrics)
predictions.rationale: Rising super-long yields increase pressure for policy recalibration, but BOJ could choose communication tools instead of a large cut.

predictions.text: China will raise its equity transaction tax/stamp duty (or reintroduce an increased rate) by at least 0.05 percentage points for mainland A-share trading, by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: TRUE if China’s Ministry of Finance/State Taxation Administration announces an increase (or reinstatement) of the stock transaction stamp duty rate by ≥0.05pp affecting A-shares. FALSE if no such rate increase by deadline.
evidence: CNBC (2026-01-20) reports overheating signs in China’s equities with record turnover and rising regulatory wariness.
monitoring_signals: MOF/STA announcements on stamp duty adjustments
CSRC measures targeting turnover, margin, or speculative trading
State-media editorials signaling intent to cool equity-market speculation
predictions.rationale: Authorities sometimes use transaction taxes to dampen speculation, but it conflicts with market-support goals, making it a low-probability but clear trigger.

predictions.text: At least one private-credit fund will publicly announce a final close of a single flagship private-credit strategy with committed capital of at least $20 billion (USD), by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: TRUE if a manager press release (or reputable coverage citing firm confirmation) states a final close for one private-credit fund/vehicle at ≥$20B commitments by deadline. Excludes multi-fund platform totals unless explicitly one fund.
evidence: CNBC (2026-01-20) notes private credit continues raising billions despite warnings, indicating strong fundraising momentum.
monitoring_signals: Fund manager press releases (Apollo/Ares/Blackstone/KKR/Blue Owl/etc.)
Institutional Investor/WSJ/FT reporting on large final closes
SEC Form D filings and fundraising updates on earnings calls
predictions.rationale: Given recent fundraising scale and momentum, a $20B+ close by mid-2026 is moderately likely.

predictions.text: The U.S. House of Representatives will pass (simple majority) a standalone bill establishing a federal framework for payment stablecoins (issuer licensing/supervision + reserve requirements), by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: TRUE if House roll-call or recorded vote shows passage of a stablecoin framework bill that includes (a) issuer licensing/supervision and (b) reserve/backing requirements. FALSE otherwise by deadline.
evidence: CNBC (2026-01-19) highlights real-economy ‘dollarization via stablecoins’ dynamics (USDT usage) underscoring policy attention to stablecoins.
monitoring_signals: House Financial Services Committee markups and bill text publication
Floor scheduling announcements and whip counts
Statements from Treasury/Fed/FDIC/OCC supporting or opposing a framework
predictions.rationale: Stablecoin policy salience is rising; House passage is plausible even if Senate convergence remains uncertain.

predictions.text: NOAA’s Space Weather Prediction Center will issue at least one G4 (Severe) or G5 (Extreme) geomagnetic storm alert (Kp=8 or 9) during 2026-01-20 through 2026-03-31 (UTC), by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: TRUE if SWPC posts an alert/notice confirming G4 or G5 levels reached (or observed) at least once in the window, with timestamped public notice. FALSE otherwise.
evidence: NOAA SWPC (2026-01-19) reported G4 severe geomagnetic-storm conditions reached, indicating elevated activity.
monitoring_signals: SWPC alerts/watches/warnings for geomagnetic storms
Solar flare and CME event reports (X-class flare incidence, halo CMEs)
Kp forecasts and real-time magnetometer readings referenced by SWPC
predictions.rationale: Recent G4 event plus active solar conditions makes another severe storm within ~10 weeks plausible but far from certain.

predictions.text: SpaceX (Starlink) will publicly acknowledge a geomagnetic-storm-related service disruption affecting Starlink users for at least 2 continuous hours (broad regional impact, not a single-site outage), by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: TRUE if SpaceX/Starlink posts a public statement (X/status page/blog) attributing a Starlink outage/degradation lasting ≥2 hours to geomagnetic storm/space weather. FALSE otherwise.
evidence: NOAA SWPC (2026-01-19) reported severe geomagnetic-storm conditions, which can disrupt satellite operations and communications.
monitoring_signals: Starlink status page incident logs and SpaceX/Starlink X posts
SWPC storm alerts coinciding with reported connectivity issues
NetBlocks/DownDetector spikes contemporaneous with SWPC G-scale events
predictions.rationale: Space weather can degrade LEO comms; explicit public attribution by SpaceX is the key uncertainty.

predictions.text: QuantumScape will publicly confirm shipment of “B-sample” (or explicitly B-sample-equivalent) solid-state battery cells to at least one automotive OEM, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: TRUE if QuantumScape press release, shareholder letter, or earnings call transcript explicitly states B-sample (or B-sample-equivalent) cells were shipped/delivered to an automotive OEM. FALSE otherwise by deadline.
evidence: Recent attention to battery/materials advances (e.g., silver-enabled solid-state improvements) suggests accelerating development and commercialization focus.
monitoring_signals: QuantumScape quarterly shareholder letters and earnings call transcripts
OEM partner announcements referencing solid-state sample stages
SEC filings (10-Q/8-K) noting milestone completions or customer deliveries
predictions.rationale: Solid-state timelines are volatile; shipment confirmation is plausible within 2026H1 but remains uncertain.
